title: THE ENTITY
text: Denver International Airport, day. Inside the terminal people are in long lines waiting to get their tickets or get on a plane. Mr. Garrison waits in line to have his bags scanned.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Jesus Christ, these lines are ridiculous! I'm gonna miss my flight!  E- Excuse me, there are two other security checkpoints. Why can't you open those, too?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Uh I don't know nothin'.

title: THE ENTITY
text: But you work for the-  uh, God-damnit!!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Snooty Airlines announces the arrival of flight 239 from Connecticut.

title: THE ENTITY
text: The Broflovskis stand in front of a perfume shop

title: THE ENTITY
text: That's your cousin's flight, Kyle. Hold the sign up nice and high so he can find us.

title: THE ENTITY
text: What's he look like?

title: THE ENTITY
text: He's your age and about your height.

title: THE ENTITY
text: I'm stoked my cousin is comin' to live with us. It'll be just like having a brother.

title: THE ENTITY
text: I todd a nurra

title: THE ENTITY
text: Oh, there he is.  Over here, Kyle!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Hello, Aunt Sheila.

title: THE ENTITY
text: How was your flight?

title: THE ENTITY
text: :	Oh, it was terrible. They they recycled the air on board and it really did a number on my asthma. I-I-e-I asked them to turn up the oxygen and they wouldn't.

title: THE ENTITY
text: You rememer uncle Gerry.

title: THE ENTITY
text: :	Hi, Uncle Gerry.

title: THE ENTITY
text: :	 And these are your cousin, Ike and Kyle

title: THE ENTITY
text: Hey dude.

title: THE ENTITY
text: It's nice to meet you.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Let's get down to the baggage claim, Kyle.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Okay:

title: THE ENTITY
text: Oooh, that's right! We've got two Kyles now. We'll just call you  Kyle, and you can be Kyle...  Two!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Cool.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Ticket counter. Mr. Garrison's turn has come up and he approaches the counter

title: THE ENTITY
text: Next?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Oh, I feel like I've run a marathon.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Mmmokay, the 2:30 flight to Cheyenne has boarded. Looks like you didn't make it.

title: THE ENTITY
text: What? Well of course I didn't make it. The line to check in was two hours long, and the security line was two hours more!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Nnnyeah, no problem, though. We'll get you on the 7 a.m. flight tomorrow morning.

title: THE ENTITY
text: I can't go tomorrow, the Jizzfest is tonight!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Would you like a window or an aisle seat?

title: THE ENTITY
text: This is unbelievable! You know, I seem to remember when the airlines said, "We need a 15 billion dollar bailout from the taxpayers-"!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Mmokay, and have any of your personal items been out of your possession since you left?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Well we gave them the 15 billion dollar bailout and they fired their employees anyway! So now we have three people to clear 400 passengers!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Hey,he's right!

title: THE ENTITY
text: YEAH!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Okay, and bags have been with you at all times?

title: THE ENTITY
text: So where did that money go? I'll tell you where it went: it went into the pockets of the preseidents and CEOs of the airlines, so they can keep their miltimillion dollar salaries!

title: THE ENTITY
text: YEAH!

title: THE ENTITY
text: And here's your boarding pass for tomorrow morning.

title: THE ENTITY
text: You think you can treat us however you want because we HAVE to fly! Well I'll tell you what, Sally Sassalot, I'm gonna come up with a NEW mode of transportation! A ahah brand new vehicle that'll put all you bastards out of business!

title: THE ENTITY
text: YEAH! ALRIGHT! GO!

title: THE ENTITY
text: You think I can't do it?! I got a master's degree in mechanical engineering at Denver Community College! You watch me!!  Come on, everybody!

title: THE ENTITY
text: YEAH!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Can I get on that 7:30 a.m. flight?

title: THE ENTITY
text: The Broflovski house, night. The family is seated around the dining room table as Sheila enters with soup in hand

title: THE ENTITY
text: Here we go, Kyle Two.  And here's yours, Kyle.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Oh, uh, wawawhat is this?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Mom's special stew. She makes it every Monday and I love it.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Oh is, is this beef?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Yeah, dude, it's great!

text: Uha, wa, actually, I, I can't eat beef. I have a degenerative problem with my intestinal lining, and beef really gives me gaass.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Oh, I'm so sorry, Kyle. What else can I fix you?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Oh no, I d- I don't want to be a bother, I uh-

title: THE ENTITY
text: Nonsense. Can't I make you some nice pasta? Or a frozen fish fillet?

title: THE ENTITY
text: We-ull, some fish would be great if it isn't too much trouble.

title: THE ENTITY
text: I'll put it in the microwave right away.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Kitchen, moments later. Sheila has gotten the fish and breaks it apart on the kitchen counter. Kyle Two appears at the doorway

title: THE ENTITY
text: Mom?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Yes, Kyle Two?

title: THE ENTITY
text: How am I related to him again?

text: He's your cousin, Kyle Two. I told you already.

text: Yeah, but like... first cousin or distant cousin?

title: THE ENTITY
text: He's my sister's son. That makes him your first cousin.

title: THE ENTITY
text: So we have the same blood?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Now Kyle Two, listen to me. Kyle is going through a very tough time in his life. His mother is very sick and he's in a whole new place. He's going to rely on you to make sure he fits in at your school.

title: THE ENTITY
text: What?? How the hell am I supposed to do that??

title: THE ENTITY
text: I'm sure your friends will love him.

title: THE ENTITY
text: What about Cartman, huh? He rips on me for being Jewish! He's gonna tear this kid apart!

text: Kyle Two, he's your responsibility.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Oh my God.

title: THE ENTITY
text: I'm sure you two will become great friends with lots of late night pillow talk.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Well what do you mean?  What room is he sleeping in?

text: Kyle's room, past bed time. Both Kyles are in bed, the cousin getting used to the bed.

title: THE ENTITY
text: What's this comforter filled with? Um, it isn't filled with down, is it?

title: THE ENTITY
text: I don't know, dude.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Ih it sure is quiet up here in the mountains and it's dry, too. Do you have a humidi-humidifier?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Uh, can you take my stupid glasses and put them on the night stand. Make sure they're close by, because that fish upset my stomach and I might need them if I have to go to he bathroom later on.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Okay.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Mr. Garrison's house, night. He's working at an artist's desk in his bedroom. On the wall are drawings of various types of aircraft, and on the floor around him are bits and pieces of all kinds of vehicles, including bicycle gears, airplane propellers, car motors, a muffler. To his right is a dresser with a small color TV on top. Mr. Hat is present on his right hand, as always.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Now it's got to be simple. Like a moped, but with the ability to travel at much faster speeds. The designs of our electrical moped were altered with a- no, nonono this won't work either!

title: THE ENTITY
text: What was wrong with that plan?

title: THE ENTITY
text: It has to be more stable, Mr. Hat! A moped would be too dangerous at those speeds. Damnit!  Now, what if the jet power of an aircraft could be scaled down into a personal vehicle?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Boy, that Enrique Iglesias can sure gyrate his hot ass around.

title: THE ENTITY
text: ...I think about you day and night. I think about you...

title: THE ENTITY
text: Oh, Mr. Hat! Would you stop drooling over Enrique Iglesias and... wait a minute. What did you say?

title: THE ENTITY
text: I said Enrique Iglesias can sure gyrate his hot ass!

title: THE ENTITY
text: That's it. Gyration.  A gyrascope. It would allow for maximum balance and yet... Mr. Hat! You're a genius!  It's so simple and yet genius!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Check out his hot bulge, too.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Bus stop, next day. Kenny, Stan and Cartman wait at the stop. The two Kyles walk up to them.

text: Hey dude.

text: Cartman, I'm gonna make you a deal.

text: What?

text: That kid over there is my cousin from the East Coast. He's having a really hard time right now, so I'm going to offer you forty dollars to not rip on him.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Forty bucks?

title: THE ENTITY
text: But you can't make fun of him AT ALL. No smartass comments, nothin'.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Alrigh, alright.

title: THE ENTITY

title: THE ENTITY
text: Aw, Jesus, why don't you just cut off my balls?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Cartman, no Jew jokes! All you have to do is keep your mouth shut, and you've got forty bucks! Can you do it?

title: THE ENTITY
text: I can't believe how cold it is out here.

text: Cold be tough. But I'll give it a shot.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Alright.

title: THE ENTITY
text: It's a reall dry cold; that's the problem. It- the cold air makes me wheeze.

text: Kyle, this is Cartman, my sort of... friend- ish.

text: Ot- Nice to meet you, Cartman. Yuh you know, I saw that same jacket you're wearing at Bosco's for 29.95. How much was yours? Um, I juh- I was just wondering if Bosco's is a ripoff?

text: ...Oh, man.

text: Cartman?!

text: Uh, it's nice to meet you, Kyle. I can certainly tell you're a relative of my good friend Kyle here.

title: THE ENTITY
text: What the hell was that?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Neighborhood, day. Barbardy stops Craig's father in his car and is writing out a ticket when the large wheel zips by them.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Uh what the hell was that?

text: Dowtown South Park. People walk about doing stuff. The giant wheel zips by them as well, but few seem to notice.

title: THE ENTITY
text: What the hell was that?

title: THE ENTITY
text: I dunno, it was going so fast I couldn't see it.  But I want one.

title: THE ENTITY

text: Garrison's house, curb level. The giant wheel stops and two legs dismount. It's Mr. Garrison, beaming with pride and confidence

title: THE ENTITY
text: We've done it, Mr. Hat. Airline companies be damned. We've invented a whole new mode of transportation! Get some investors on the phone!  Well what are you waiting for?!

title: THE ENTITY
text: South Park Elementary, day. Class is now in session.

title: THE ENTITY
text: And I know you'll all be very nice to our new student.  Kyle, why don't you tell us a little about yourself?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Oh well, I I grew up in the shity, ah ah I really don't care for it. Ah I come from a Jewish family, which of course you already know, because Kyle's form the same family.  I like to read, and I have these polyps on the backs of my hands - I don't know what they are.

text: Ohmigod, I'm not gonna make it. I'm not gonna make it.

text: What?

text: Eh, oh, alright.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Now let's get on with our lesson on the-

text: Ah-ah-ah-are wooden desks all that available? I usually prefer the plastic ones because these give me splinters.

text: Ugh, ugh!

text: Now Kyle, I need you to be quiet. In my class you need to be able to concentrate.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Oh!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Concentration is the key to succeeding in my class.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Maybe we'll have to send him to concentration camp. AWGH! Damnit, damnit, damnit!

title: THE ENTITY
text: CARTMAN!

title: THE ENTITY
text: News 4 Newsbreak. An anchor soon appears with a window of Mr. Garrsion beside him

title: THE ENTITY
text: Kindergarten teacher Herbert Garrison has apparently invented a new vehicle that will give the airlines a run for their money. Mr. Garrison is putting the final touches on his top secret device, which he simply calls "IT". So what exactly is "IT"?  Here with a report is a Hispanic man with some gravy stains on his lapel.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Thanks, Tom, I-oh...  Thanks, Tom. So far Herbert Garrison hasn't let anyone get a look at his invention. He claims that the vehicle is sooo genius and revolutionary that it could cause one's eyes to bleed if not properly prepared to see it. But earlier today HBC News got footage of some of the country's top investors and richest people who have been invited for a first look, including: Steve Forbes , Steve Jobs , Ted Turner , Donald Trump , Bill Gates , and Yasmine Bleeth . Their curiosity is piqued, Tom, and so is ours. What is "IT"? What does "IT"do? And when will IT be somewhere where I can buy one? Reporting live, Jeff Arrando , HBC News.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Playground, day. Kids are on swings, hobby elephants, slides, etc, as the camera pans across. At the end of the pan, Kyle and Kyle Two face each other in a clearing

title: THE ENTITY
text: You need to learn to play some sports, Kyle. So we're gonna start with a tough one called, "Catch the Ball." I throw the football to you; you throw it back to me.

text: It's fine!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Alright then, hu-how do I catch it?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Ih it's a football, dude. You just- put your arms out and catch it.  Alright, here we go.

text: Now what?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Now throw it back to me.

title: THE ENTITY
text: But it's down in the snow.

title: THE ENTITY

text: But I'll get snow on my gloves and then it will melt and I'll have wet hands.

text: ...Well, then we'll dry them off!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Alright, then.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Oh my God.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Kyle, Kyle!  I just found out that in World War II, some Jewish people were sent to concentration camps.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Yeah! They WERE, Cartman!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Oh, and see, I didn't realize that. But I understand now how you might've felt what I said in the classroom was a racial slut. But see, I had no idea.

title: THE ENTITY
text: You did, too! You are so full of crap!

title: THE ENTITY
text: No, I'm seriously! Becuase, um, I was, I was talkin' to Craig, and Craig was all like, "Hey, did you know that in World War II they really HAD concentration camps?" And I was all like, "No way!" And this little light went on in my head like, "Aw man, no wonder Kyle thought what I said in the class, seemed like it was directed at his cousin." But, but I was literally talkin' about a concentration camp, you know, where you go for a week to learn and focus, you know. Oh, mahan.  What a misunderstanding, huh?

title: THE ENTITY
text: You blew the deal, Cartman!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Goddamnit, give me another chance!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Nuh-uh, I knew you were gonna make fun of my lame cousin, so I paid you the forty bucks NOT to rip on him! You ripped on him, deal's off!

text: Uh you did what?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Oh no.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Haha,  serves you right, asshole.

title: THE ENTITY

title: THE ENTITY
text: Look, ih it's not because anything's wrong with you.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Wow uh, you think it takes forty dollars to get people to like me.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Kyle, I-eh I'm sorry

title: THE ENTITY
text: Becuase I m-I mean I really think you could have done it for about 12.50.

title: THE ENTITY
text: What?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Well, I mean, you didn't just start at 40, didja? You you gotta low-ball these things so you have a place to go.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Uh-uh-uh oh, dude. Uh

text: Mr. Garrison's house, backyard. The invited guest sit in two rows of chairs

text: Gentlemen, imagine being able to travel safely at incredibly fast speeds, and not having to go to the stupid fartface airports!

text: Nice

text: Now, IT is easily operated using four flexigrip handles. Two of them are on each side. Left side for throttle, right side for steering.  The third flexigrip is gently inserted into the anus, to keep the driver in place.

text: Ugh. Oh.

text: I can't take it anymore, Stan. My cousin's been here for two weeks and he's driving me insane.

That somehow his mannerisms will start rubbing off on me, and I'll become a stereotype. I mean, I'm a Jew and he's making me hate Jews.

text: Commercial

title: THE ENTITY
text: Are you tired of coprporate airline companies treating you like a worthless sardine?  Tired of ridiculous lines and horrible security at airports? Well, now there is an alternative to airline travel.  IT.  IT has taken the country by storm.  And already two million have been sold.  Never have another important business trip ruined by airline incompetence.  Hey ladies! How did you get to the Grand Canyon?  IT comes in sizes for the entire family.

title: THE ENTITY
text: So join the millions of Americans who have felt a little more comfortable with... traveling.  Order yours today and remember our slogan: IT's better than flying.

text: IT dealership, day. The IT has grown so popular it's left Better Buy for its own sale space. The camera pans across the showroom floor to Mr. Garrison, seated in front of an IT Moters Inc. sign. He's got a stack of bills to his right and a computer to his left, all on a futuristic desk

text: Sure.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Well,  it seems all the buttons on these front and rear flexigrips are also found on the side of the vehicle.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Yeup.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Well... so... they don't really... do anything.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Right.

title: THE ENTITY
text: So then, couldn't I just order one that works without going in and out of my ass and mouth?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Well, I... guess you could.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Huh?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Whazzat?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Wha- what did you- what did he say?

title: THE ENTITY
text: What?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Denver International Airport, day. A plane takes off. Inside the terminal the boys and Kyle stand around

title: THE ENTITY
text: I don't know about this guys. I think playing hide and seek in the airport might be dangerous.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Kyle, we told you: Kids in Colorado all play hide and seek at the airport.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Yeah, as soon as we get to the concourse you'll see how fun it is.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Ungh, this is taking too long. The flight to Connecticut is about to leave. Ey! Can we speed things up here??

title: THE ENTITY
text: Daaah, sorry, but ever since that IT thing came out the airlines have had to cut back on employees.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Dude, we're the only ones here! How long does it take five people through security?!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Derr, let's see: Twelve people... plus... times... divided... two hours domestic, three hours international.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Can't we just play hide and seek at home?

title: THE ENTITY
text: No!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Dah ha! What's this?! A toenail clipper! Die, terrorist!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Oh, Jesus!!

title: THE ENTITY
text: See, we do these checks for a reason!

title: THE ENTITY
text: This is ridiculous! Come on!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Tarmac, outside. The boys stop at a plane ready to take off.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Okay, Cartman, you're it. Start counting.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Here, Kyle. You go hide in here.

title: THE ENTITY
text: In there? But it's very confined. I'll get cramps in my legs.

title: THE ENTITY
text: JUST GET IN THE BOX!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Ub, alright then.  Oh, would you look at that? I've got a corn on my ankle. Now where did that one come from? That's the fourth one I've had-

title: THE ENTITY
text: I hope he doesn't suffocate.

title: THE ENTITY
text: He's faaahn.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Yeah. He'll be waaay better off back at home.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Oh, Jesus, this bus is going fast! Oh, I did it again!!

title: THE ENTITY
text: IT dealership, day. Crowds mill around the dealership. Federal agents raid the building and start hauling ITs away. Mr. Garrison isn't pleased.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Excuse me, what the hell are you doing?

title: THE ENTITY
text: It's alright, we're with the government.

title: THE ENTITY
text: We're just shutting you down.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Shutting me down? Why?

title: THE ENTITY
text: The airlines are in desperate trouble. Your vehicle is causing them to lose money.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Yeah, well that was the point, dingleberry! Ah-t put that down!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Right, so the governmentn is bailing the airlines out again, but shutting you down and making ITs illegal.

title: THE ENTITY
text: OH, GOD-DAMNIT! You'd better be kidding!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Sir, many people work for the airlines. We can't let them all be fired.

title: THE ENTITY
text: THE AIRLINE COMPANIES ARE LOSING MONEY BECAUSE OF THEIR OWN INCOMPETENCE AND THEIR OWN INEFFICIENCY!!

title: THE ENTITY
text: That may be truu. But if you build, sell, or ride another IT, "it" will be the last time. Have a nice night.

title: THE ENTITY
text: HWAAAAHHH! Airline motherfuckerrrs! You pieces of shiiit! Cocksucking sons of bitch airlines!

title: THE ENTITY
text: The Broflovski house, night. In the living room, Sheila paces the floor as Kyle sits on the sofa.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Oh, it's been days! Where can he be?

title: THE ENTITY
text: I dunno, Mom. It's like he vanished into thin air.

title: THE ENTITY
text: I'm gong to call the police again. Kyle Two, go down to the playground and look there.

title: THE ENTITY
text: I already checked the playground, Ma. I told you, he isn't really-

title: THE ENTITY
text: I'm back.

title: THE ENTITY
text: GAAAH!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Kyle!  You're back!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Yeah, it was the craziest thing. I hid myself on a plane to Antarctica. Oh, it was so dry down there.

title: THE ENTITY
text: The Broflovski house, a few days later. Stan and Cartman approach the door. Inside, Kyle is standing in the living room, his arms crossed. He's clearly pissed off. The door opens, and Stan and Cartman walk in.

title: THE ENTITY
text: So dude, did Cartman's idea work?

title: THE ENTITY
text: No. I tried getting my cousin lost in the woods, but a stupid bear brought him home.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Damn!

title: THE ENTITY
text: I just have to face facts that I'm gointuh live with my crappy cousin forever.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Well, Kyle, I I gotta go.

title: THE ENTITY
text: ...What?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Yeah, I've gotta get back to Connecticut.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Now that things have changed for Kyle, his mother needs him back.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Do you promise??  I mean, oh. Thah-uh that's too bad, dude. What, what changed for you?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Well, I I invested in that IT thng, and there was a bailout, so I received a five million dollar bailout clause check, which, which I can use to help my family, so, I I guess, goodbye, cousin.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Okay. See ya, cousin. Hope to see ya soon.  Not too soon, I hope.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Yeah, haha

title: THE ENTITY
text: Heheheheheh.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Five million dollars???

title: THE ENTITY
text: Dudedudedude! You you have five miliion dollars??

title: THE ENTITY
text: Yeah, I don't know what to do with it, though. Well, see ya.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Wait. Kyle, this may sound crazy, but I think you should stay!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Yeah!

title: THE ENTITY
text: Ru really?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Yeah. You see, I've learned something today.  Sometimes people have trouble fitting in at, at school and,...  and um... Let's see, what did I learn about? What did I learn about today?

title: THE ENTITY
text: I I, I learned that... you shouldn't judge somebody because... that-no, wait.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Nonono, it was good! What were you going to say?

title: THE ENTITY
text: Listen, guys, I appreaciate you wanting me around, but, the fact of the matter is, well, yeh, you guys are just kind of douche bags.

title: THE ENTITY
text: ... Uhwhat?

title: THE ENTITY
text: I mean, yeyou people are all just such hick jock rednecks; it's just like you right out of a stereotyped catalog. Ah I can't take it. See ya.

title: THE ENTITY
text: Dude! Weak.

title: THE ENTITY
text: ...Good job, Jew!
